messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: explosive children
messages.msgSnippet: More than anyother kind of activity playing vikings in his viking ship(clubhouse) pretnding to sword fight really helps him.I have no idea why but it does.
messages.messageBody:
More than anyother kind of activity playing vikings in his viking ship(clubhouse) pretnding to sword fight really helps him.I have no idea why but it does.
Tricia

Joanne <billyandjoanne@...> wrote:
>>" I think these explosive children also do much better with lots of
physical activity, at least that is the case with Tristan.">>>>

I have found this with my older two also. Cimion has bipolar disorder
(like I posted ) and we just took Shawna off Adderall. (yipee!!!)
Besides the usual bikes, skateboards, rollerblads & skateboards, we
have a pogo stick (I highly recommend these!) and big wooden playset
and we just bought a 14' trampoline.

~ Joanne ~
Mom to Jacqueline (7), Shawna (10) & Cimion (13)
Adopted into our hearts October 30, 2003
http://anunschoolinglife.blogspot.com/
http://foreverparents.com

messages.subject: explosive children
messages.msgSnippet: I think these explosive children also do much better with lots of physical activity, at least that is the case with Tristan. Jalen too. Sierra got him a
messages.messageBody:
" I think these
explosive children also do much better with lots of physical activity,
at least that is the case with Tristan."

Jalen too.
Sierra got him a small scooter for Christmas, and Markus got him a
bouncy ball (like a hippety hop) that you bounce around on.
He's been alternating between the two, crusing through the living
room, dining room and kitchen in a big circle and occasionally zooming
up the hallway.
He's been in almost constant motion today.
Next on the list, a mini-trampoline and a swing chair from IKEA.

Ren

messages.subject: re: explosive children
messages.messageBody:
<<<<<I know for me I am most peaceful when I am in nature and winter
time is a
challenge, when we get cut off from all the wonderful green plants.
You might
want to consider filling your spaces with lots of plants, trees in
pots. >>>>>>

That is interesting because Tristan is DEFINITELY the happiest when he
is outside. He is almost giddy, no he is giddy when he gets out in
nature. He LOVES to hike so, consequently, we do a lot of hiking. It
is part of the reason we wanted to get out of Alaska, so we could have
more of the year to be outside in nice weather. Thankfully, the
entire family loves to hike so it is a great thing. I think these
explosive children also do much better with lots of physical activity,
at least that is the case with Tristan.

Heidi
